results.title: The Davis Cup, 1951
results.brief_description: The story of Australia’s fight to retain the world tennis premiership. The film covers the Interzone Final in Melbourne between Sweden and the USA and the Challenge Round in Sydney between the USA and Australia. Narrated by Michael Charlton and Peter Whitchurch.

results.title: Dates
results.creator_credit: Donovan Miller and Hollywood Film Enterprises
results.brief_description: Date growing in the Coachella Valley of Southern California. Outlines the history of date cultivation in the region; shows artificial pollination, harvesting, grading and packing of the fruit.

results.title: Date with history: Hiroshima
results.brief_description: Shows the preliminary events leading up to the bombing of Hiroshima in August, 1945 in which 72,000 people were killed. some of the people involved are interviewed, giving their reactions to the holocaust. The film contains actual footage of the events.

results.title: Danish design
results.creator_credit: Brandon Films and Danish Society of Arts and Crafts and Independent Designers
results.brief_description: Danish contemporary art and design. Examples of the best known furniture designers, fabrics, silverware and kitchen utensils, illustrate Danish functionalism inspired by craft traditions, art and culture of other countries. A skilled craftsman is shown making a chair.

results.title: The Dangerous years
results.creator_credit: William T. Cartwright and Bud Wiser
results.brief_description: Examines the juvenile crime dilemma facing society today. Through actual on-the-spot scenes, this film reveals the world of the juvenile offender and the often frustrated efforts of the police to stem the tide of juvenile crime.

results.title: The Dandelion
results.brief_description: A study using time-lapse and microcinematography of the Dandelion as a typical example of the group, Compositae, including the processes of cross and self-pollination, fertilisation and germination.

results.title: Dancing orpheus
results.brief_description: The unique Australian lyrebird, this most elusive of all birds, is observed in its natural habitat. A long sequence, excellently photographed and brilliantly recorded sound, shows the bird performing its famous courting dance. The long hours of patient photography involved have been rewarded with the following awards - Australian Film Awards, Nature Section, Gold Award “for nature shots, lyrically observed and creatively connected.” Kodak Silver Medallion for best black and white photography.
results.description: The unique Australian lyrebird, this most elusive of all birds, is observed in its natural habitat. results.title: The Dancing fleece
results.creator_credit: Frederick Wilson, Carl Koch and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: Illustrates, through the medium of ballet, the manufacturing processes for woollen fabrics. A wool worker visits a fair and, looking into a slot machine, sees clock-work puppets come to life. He and the puppets, now ballet dancers, interpret the various stages in wool production in terms of ballet. The film features dancer and choreographer, Harold Turner, and the Saddlers Wells Ballet Company.

results.title: The Dam builders: beavers and man
results.creator_credit: L. Richard Ellison, National Educational Television and Time-Life Broadcast
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World We Live In”.
A comparison of the ecological changes brought about by the dam building activities of two species of mammals - humans and the beaver. It shows that all life is interdependent and points out how humans are damaging the ecological balance of nature whereas the beaver, although bringing change to its area, is not. Shows beavers in north America and engineers in Africa. Narrated by Joseph Julian.
